description.value: The code indicating the type and priority of an inpatient admission associated with the service on an intermediary submitted claim. Source: https://bluebutton.cms.gov/resources/variables/clm_ip_admsn_type_cd

display.value: Emergency - The patient required immediate medical intervention as a result of severe, life threatening, or potentially disabling conditions. Generally, the patient was admitted through the emergency room.

definition.value: Emergency - The patient required immediate medical intervention as a result of severe, life threatening, or potentially disabling conditions. Generally, the patient was admitted through the emergency room.

display.value: Urgent - The patient required immediate attention for the care and treatment of a physical or mental disorder. Generally, the patient was admitted to the first available and suitable accommodation.

definition.value: Urgent - The patient required immediate attention for the care and treatment of a physical or mental disorder. Generally, the patient was admitted to the first available and suitable accommodation.

display.value: Elective - The patient's condition permitted adequate time to schedule the availability of suitable accommodations.

definition.value: Elective - The patient's condition permitted adequate time to schedule the availability of suitable accommodations.

display.value: Newborn - Necessitates the use of special source of admission codes.

definition.value: Newborn - Necessitates the use of special source of admission codes.

display.value: Trauma Center - visits to a trauma center/hospital as licensed or designated by the State or local government authority authorized to do so, or as verified by the American College of Surgeons and involving a trauma activation.

definition.value: Trauma Center - visits to a trauma center/hospital as licensed or designated by the State or local government authority authorized to do so, or as verified by the American College of Surgeons and involving a trauma activation.
